intro: Ceterach alternans, commonly known as the sea holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Crambe. It is native to the coastal regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments. Ceterach alternans is adapted to salt spray and can withstand harsh coastal conditions.
